intro: Pentacalia schultzei subsp. sevillana, commonly known as the Seville pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with a compact growth habit, often forming low, bushy clumps. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
